text: OK ye it's definitely a fair point. I just wasn't aware of the separation in departments, it's crazy how specialised it is. But at least I have a direction now. I think I'd like to do a destruction rbd sim. Maybe a procedural house with various materials. Maybe it's a bit cliche but I'm guessing it's a common effect that studios have to achieve right? What do you think?

RBD destruction is good because it shows a variety of different types of fx.  You'll have to first do the rbd destruction using bullet or whatever, and then you'll need to add particles with a POP sim and lastly a pyro volume for all the dust.  A good RBD destruction on a reel with all of the elements is a great idea for a reel piece.

And yes studios are specialized but I think FX is the best (i'm biased of course), because there's lots of different types of things to do and you're less likely to get bored.  CFX only does cloth (we have a seperate department at Framestore called "groom" that does hair).  And crowd people only do crowd. Crowd is very niche and not typically a big department.

So I'd say focusing on FX might be your best bet unless you REALLY LOVE cfx or crowd.   FX is everything else.  Fire, water, explosions, smoke, destruction, dust, rain, snow, supernatural effects, etc, etc.

CFX is a big department though and people there seem to really like their jobs too.  You'll most likely be using Maya for that in a studio environment though.  Don't know many (if any) studios using cloth in their CFX pipeline.
